title: com.github.beanio:beanio:3.0.0.M2 not working in native build
body:
### Describe the bug

Maybe not a bug, but some configuration issue?

I have a service which processes a file using the com.github.beanio:beanio:3.0.0.M2 to parse some records into an object.
This works fine in a normal (non native) build, but fails with a native image.

I have a configuration class with the following piece of code which should create a beanio StreamFactory:

```
@Produces
@ApplicationScoped
public StreamFactory produceFileStreamFactory() {
	final var streamFactory = StreamFactory.newInstance();
	final var builder = new StreamBuilder("file")
			.format("fixedlength")
			.ignoreUnidentifiedRecords()
			.addRecord(FileRecord.class);
	streamFactory.define(builder);
	return streamFactory;
}
```

And in my class that processes the file, I use this factory. However, when running a native image, I get a NullPointerException on the factory.createReader, because factory is null:

```
@ApplicationScoped
@AllArgsConstructor
public class FileProcessor {

	private final StreamFactory factory;     // IN NATIVE IMAGE THIS IS NULL!
	private final RecordProcessor recordProcessor
	private final Logger logger;

	public void processFile(Long id) throws IOException {
		try {
			try (final var br = getReader(id); // reads file with id
					final var beanReader = factory.createReader("file", br)) { // NullPointerException since factory is null
				var record = (FileRecord) beanReader.read();
				while (notEndOfFile(record)) {
					processRecord(record);
					record = (FileRecord) beanReader.read();
				}
			}
		} catch (Exception e) {
			logger(e); // logs the NullPointerException
			throw e;
		}
	}
	// some more methods
}
```

The QuarkusIntegrationTest fails and shows a stacktrace (see below), which doesn't really give a clue to what was wrong until I caught and logged the exception.
My guess is that the beanio factory doesn't work out of the box and I need to configure something with regards to reflection? I have tried to add a `ReflectionsConfig` class, but that didn't help (maybe it needs more configuration?):

```
import io.quarkus.runtime.annotations.RegisterForReflection;
import org.beanio.BeanReader;
import org.beanio.StreamFactory;

@RegisterForReflection(targets = {
		BeanReader.class,
		StreamFactory.class
})
public class ReflectionsConfig {
}
```

How could I get beanio to work with a native image?

The stacktrace:

### Expected behavior

Expect factory to be created and no NullPointerException.

### Actual behavior

Factory is null and NullPointerException occurs.

### How to Reproduce?

_No response_

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Linux ..... 5.15.0-60-generic #66~20.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Wed Jan 25 09:41:30 UTC 2023 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

### Output of `java -version`

OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM Temurin-17.0.2+8 (build 17.0.2+8, mixed mode, sharing)

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.15.3.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

3.8.6

### Additional information

_No response_
